GT.content: violence of gift: takes by surprise in such a way as to trap, indebt the receiver, place, hold in a process of circulation, but this violence irreducible whether it repeats or interrupts the circle
GT.linkedContent: violence of gift: takes by surprise in such a way as to trap, indebt the receiver, place, hold in a process of circulation, but this violence irreducible whether it repeats or interrupts the circle

GT.content: or: a surprise surprising enough to be forgotten w/out delay, beyond Being, epekeina tes ousia: secret about which one cannot speak, but can no longer remain silent
GT.linkedContent: or: a surprise surprising enough to be forgotten w/out delay, beyond Being, epekeina tes ousia: secret about which one cannot speak, but can no longer remain silent

BL.content: law is not a woman, not a feminine figure—even if man wants to enter, penetrate it (that’s its trap [makes you think it’s feminine?])
BL.linkedContent: law is not a woman, not a feminine figure—even if man wants to enter, penetrate it (that’s its trap [makes you think it’s feminine?])

MPM.content: de Man’s texts on promise pervert tranquil assurance of what we call “performative” > too much of promise is irremediable disturbance/perversion, is also a trap, also renders promise possible (indestructible), and comical
MPM.linkedContent: de Man’s texts on promise pervert tranquil assurance of what we call “performative” > too much of promise is irremediable disturbance/perversion, is also a trap, also renders promise possible (indestructible), and comical

MPM.content: auto-deconstruction where auto-, self can’t be reflected/totalized/gathered/recollected only written and caught in trap of promise
MPM.linkedContent: auto-deconstruction where auto-, self can’t be reflected/totalized/gathered/recollected only written and caught in trap of promise

PP.content: dictum pronounces itself against itself as soon as it finds its way into writing, “contradiction” as relation-to-self of diction chasing itself away by hunting its trap (scription); not a contingent contradiction [confirmed by Platonism in Rousseau, Saussure]
PP.linkedContent: dictum pronounces itself against itself as soon as it finds its way into writing, “contradiction” as relation-to-self of diction chasing itself away by hunting its trap (scription); not a contingent contradiction [confirmed by Platonism in Rousseau, Saussure]

PAS.content: pas de don has to recall itself in order to come about: knot (pas) of truth, truth of knot (pas) > begins to be ensnared in trap of law
PAS.linkedContent: pas de don has to recall itself in order to come about: knot (pas) of truth, truth of knot (pas) > begins to be ensnared in trap of law

PAS.content: diabolism, double of sovereignty, its trap must take on all forms of sovereignty: méconnaissance and forgetting w/out remains; sovereign traps the devil, lui donnant ainsi raison, risks leaving him the last word
PAS.linkedContent: diabolism, double of sovereignty, its trap must take on all forms of sovereignty: méconnaissance and forgetting w/out remains; sovereign traps the devil, lui donnant ainsi raison, risks leaving him the last word

FWT.content: to say “I’m Jewish, I can’t be accused when disconcerted by Israel”—programmed death of slightest lucidity, responsibility, deadly trap must be avoided at all costs
FWT.linkedContent: to say “I’m Jewish, I can’t be accused when disconcerted by Israel”—programmed death of slightest lucidity, responsibility, deadly trap must be avoided at all costs

DS.content: no total/proper meaning because blank folds over (se plie), dès que le blanc (est) blanc, (se) blanchit, as soon as there’s a mark, there’s a re-mark, no blank w/ capital B, no theology of Text, yet desire for reappropriation, structural site of theological trap, is produced, nourished, in very act of separating from it
DS.linkedContent: no total/proper meaning because blank folds over (se plie), dès que le blanc (est) blanc, (se) blanchit, as soon as there’s a mark, there’s a re-mark, no blank w/ capital B, no theology of Text, yet desire for reappropriation, structural site of theological trap, is produced, nourished, in very act of separating from it

SP.content: Nietzsche’s style not an impregnable, infinite mastery, doesn't impeccably manipulate the snare (piège), doesn’t calculate the undecidable like Leibniz’ God (a falling back into the trap), nor does he use parody/simulacrum as a weapon, which would lead to a Nietzsche cult (interprêtrise of parody) > rhythmic blindness of hymen/margin “inscribes castration’s effect w/in itself” > dans le toile du texte, Nietzsche is lost, a spider, or spiders, unequal to the web spun
SP.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s style not an impregnable, infinite mastery, doesn't impeccably manipulate the snare (piège), doesn’t calculate the undecidable like Leibniz’ God (a falling back into the trap), nor does he use parody/simulacrum as a weapon, which would lead to a Nietzsche cult (interprêtrise of parody) > rhythmic blindness of hymen/margin “inscribes castration’s effect w/in itself” > dans le toile du texte, Nietzsche is lost, a spider, or spiders, unequal to the web spun

O.content: structure of double mark (caught [pris], both seized [emprunté] & entangled [enfermé], in binary opposition)
O.linkedContent: structure of double mark (caught [pris], both seized [emprunté] & entangled [enfermé], in binary opposition)

O.content: one of the terms retains old name to destroy opposition to which it no longer quite belongs
O.linkedContent: one of the terms retains old name to destroy opposition to which it no longer quite belongs

O.content: if one is captive to formulas and absolute knowledge, can’t think anything outside the whole, not even its mimetic double
O.linkedContent: if one is captive to formulas and absolute knowledge, can’t think anything outside the whole, not even its mimetic double

ATIA.content: God sets a trap for Cain, God as hunter, don’t fall prey to sin lurking there, a lure, a temptation [Derrida’s prowling and lurking]
ATIA.linkedContent: God sets a trap for Cain, God as hunter, don’t fall prey to sin lurking there, a lure, a temptation [Derrida’s prowling and lurking]

REST.content: restitution, remise des chaussures, snares (ret) of these shoes formed by re- prefixes, revenir
REST.linkedContent: restitution, remise des chaussures, snares (ret) of these shoes formed by re- prefixes, revenir

REST.content: everything on trial (tout chose en procès), publicized [re: Shapiro], the proximate cause is a trap: a double that doesn’t make a pair, makes a trap, can’t put one’s feet in them, Christic shade of bait [sole? proper subject? Van Gogh’s surrender?], Christ’s flesh is bait for the Devil (Muscipula Diaboli); in PAS, another type of trap > la paralyse
REST.linkedContent: everything on trial (tout chose en procès), publicized [re: Shapiro], the proximate cause is a trap: a double that doesn’t make a pair, makes a trap, can’t put one’s feet in them, Christic shade of bait [sole? proper subject? Van Gogh’s surrender?], Christ’s flesh is bait for the Devil (Muscipula Diaboli); in PAS, another type of trap > la paralyse

REST.content: all the steps of trial are traps [Heidegger assigning sole of shoe, Shapiro sending letter], as if figured in advance: to whom is the trap due (à qui revient le piège)? des chausse-trapes, des lacets, des pièges à lacets (laces of the shoes)
REST.linkedContent: all the steps of trial are traps [Heidegger assigning sole of shoe, Shapiro sending letter], as if figured in advance: to whom is the trap due (à qui revient le piège)? des chausse-trapes, des lacets, des pièges à lacets (laces of the shoes)

REST.content: Van Gogh left a trap, lacet (snare) [at bottom right corner of picture, cf. p. 258] > cette boucle étrange, une sorte de noeud esquissé, untied shoes, forms an open circle, pincers or key ring, a leash (laisse), as though taking the place of his signature [cf. DST 323n ring linked to deconstruction]
REST.linkedContent: Van Gogh left a trap, lacet (snare) [at bottom right corner of picture, cf. p. 258] > cette boucle étrange, une sorte de noeud esquissé, untied shoes, forms an open circle, pincers or key ring, a leash (laisse), as though taking the place of his signature [cf. DST 323n ring linked to deconstruction]

REST.content: logic of false parity (rather than false identity) constructs the trap?
REST.linkedContent: logic of false parity (rather than false identity) constructs the trap?

REST.content: the trap: in this lace a sort of check payable to bearer that everyone jumps to fill in, w/ his name or w/ the name of a SARL (Heidegger for the pastoral, Shapiro for the city nomad)
REST.linkedContent: the trap: in this lace a sort of check payable to bearer that everyone jumps to fill in, w/ his name or w/ the name of a SARL (Heidegger for the pastoral, Shapiro for the city nomad)

REST.content: for Heidegger, the picture is doubly useless, depicts, “shows,” being-products that’re out-of-service, w/out use-value > multiple edge(s) (bordures) detach being-product from subjective scope (portée subjective), simultaneously baiting (inducing/luring) reattachment of subjective scope
REST.linkedContent: for Heidegger, the picture is doubly useless, depicts, “shows,” being-products that’re out-of-service, w/out use-value > multiple edge(s) (bordures) detach being-product from subjective scope (portée subjective), simultaneously baiting (inducing/luring) reattachment of subjective scope

REST.content: Verlässlichkeit laces and lets loose at same time, restitutes “profoundest” going-back behind the philosophemes of matter-form, subjectivity, law, etc., but also [restitutes] most naively archaic regression to trust, that which can let itself be had (se laisser prendre), can abandon itself to the primary/crudest trap, trap before all traps, to a lure constituted by mirror play of the world, its Spiegelspiel [Levinas-like critique? or affirmation of Duplicity?]
REST.linkedContent: Verlässlichkeit laces and lets loose at same time, restitutes “profoundest” going-back behind the philosophemes of matter-form, subjectivity, law, etc., but also [restitutes] most naively archaic regression to trust, that which can let itself be had (se laisser prendre), can abandon itself to the primary/crudest trap, trap before all traps, to a lure constituted by mirror play of the world, its Spiegelspiel [Levinas-like critique? or affirmation of Duplicity?]

REST.content: betting on the pair, plus/pas de pari, trap always works in interlace (la piège marche toujours dans l’entrelacs): soit qu’il fasse marcher, laisse marcher ou qu’il paralyse [p. 373 only the pair can go]
REST.linkedContent: betting on the pair, plus/pas de pari, trap always works in interlace (la piège marche toujours dans l’entrelacs): soit qu’il fasse marcher, laisse marcher ou qu’il paralyse [p. 373 only the pair can go]

REST.content: trap is the inevitability of betting, logic of the disparate
REST.linkedContent: trap is the inevitability of betting, logic of the disparate

REST.content: don’t have to render anything: just bet on the trap like others swear (jurent) on a Bible > il y aura eu à parier, ça donne à rendre, a remmettre [there will be something to bet, it gives…] ——if faudrait “rendre” encore, donc, en se séparant, et même en laissant tomber [even in letting the matter drop, we’d render (something?)]
REST.linkedContent: don’t have to render anything: just bet on the trap like others swear (jurent) on a Bible > il y aura eu à parier, ça donne à rendre, a remmettre [there will be something to bet, it gives…] ——if faudrait “rendre” encore, donc, en se séparant, et même en laissant tomber [even in letting the matter drop, we’d render (something?)]

DST.content: question of obsession, of obsidionality, of exposure on all sides, arises w/ figure of a besieged (assiégée) power
DST.linkedContent: question of obsession, of obsidionality, of exposure on all sides, arises w/ figure of a besieged (assiégée) power

DST.content: this figure is impregnable because it has no single site, single figure
DST.linkedContent: this figure is impregnable because it has no single site, single figure

DST.content: it harasses (harcèle) out of (depuis) sa désistance all the others in turn ——traps everywhere, double bind and hyperbologic leave no way out (aucun issue)
DST.linkedContent: it harasses (harcèle) out of (depuis) sa désistance all the others in turn ——traps everywhere, double bind and hyperbologic leave no way out (aucun issue)

DST.content: must know all this to begin to think
DST.linkedContent: must know all this to begin to think

DST.content: double bind (as ending parentheses): can’t close one front w/out opening another on another side
DST.linkedContent: double bind (as ending parentheses): can’t close one front w/out opening another on another side

PIO.content: mirror as predicament, necessary or fateful situation > caught in mirror’s fatal & fascinating trap
PIO.linkedContent: mirror as predicament, necessary or fateful situation > caught in mirror’s fatal & fascinating trap

PIO.content: Derrida’s fondness for word piège [a favorite theme in light-hearted, hopeless, elliptical discussions btwn he and de Man]
PIO.linkedContent: Derrida’s fondness for word piège [a favorite theme in light-hearted, hopeless, elliptical discussions btwn he and de Man]

RM.content: different economies of metaphoric transfer (Übertragung): 1) translation in traditional (ideal) sense: transport of intact signified into another language 2) the more violent inveigling (captatrice), seductive, transformative capture by another language, fatherland, motherland—w/ such translation, proper mother tongue violated at moment of import/export
RM.linkedContent: different economies of metaphoric transfer (Übertragung): 1) translation in traditional (ideal) sense: transport of intact signified into another language 2) the more violent inveigling (captatrice), seductive, transformative capture by another language, fatherland, motherland—w/ such translation, proper mother tongue violated at moment of import/export

RM.content: always plus d’une language in the language: the capture of the crossing (croisement) that allies Ziehen and Reissen, this capture (à la fois violent/faithful, laissant sauf) affects the captor, abduction (captation), translation, into other’s language [French retrait, English re-tracing] > all this already at work (à l’oeuvre) in the other’s languages, these dealings make for a work (fait oeuvre)
RM.linkedContent: always plus d’une language in the language: the capture of the crossing (croisement) that allies Ziehen and Reissen, this capture (à la fois violent/faithful, laissant sauf) affects the captor, abduction (captation), translation, into other’s language [French retrait, English re-tracing] > all this already at work (à l’oeuvre) in the other’s languages, these dealings make for a work (fait oeuvre)

WAP.content: chaque pas est toujours piégé, defending philosophy, destroying philosophy, using fragmentary, aphoristic, elliptical language > each can serve most violent didacticism
WAP.linkedContent: chaque pas est toujours piégé, defending philosophy, destroying philosophy, using fragmentary, aphoristic, elliptical language > each can serve most violent didacticism

AFR.content: reference to Rousseau’s objection to Condillac in 2nd Discourse: Rousseau denounces [turns of Condillac’s] circle only to step into it more quickly
AFR.linkedContent: reference to Rousseau’s objection to Condillac in 2nd Discourse: Rousseau denounces [turns of Condillac’s] circle only to step into it more quickly

D.content: the opening, as presence, is not noticed as opening—we’re fascinated, glued to what presents itself: we’re unable to see presence as such, visibility of visible > never present themselves
D.linkedContent: the opening, as presence, is not noticed as opening—we’re fascinated, glued to what presents itself: we’re unable to see presence as such, visibility of visible > never present themselves

+R.content: Derrida yielded to Adami (hooked like a fish [hostage]), as if his angular signature was waiting for me [Derrida], a stupefying advance > it became Derrida's business, made him speak
+R.linkedContent: Derrida yielded to Adami (hooked like a fish [hostage]), as if his angular signature was waiting for me [Derrida], a stupefying advance > it became Derrida's business, made him speak

+R.content: into (over) the bargain (the market) (par-dessus le marché), not au-dessus (above) the market (the lure in which you would again let yourself be caught) > puts in play, or en abyme, the destructive simulacra of surplus value
+R.linkedContent: into (over) the bargain (the market) (par-dessus le marché), not au-dessus (above) the market (the lure in which you would again let yourself be caught) > puts in play, or en abyme, the destructive simulacra of surplus value

C.content: Derrida prefers s’acharner to harceler: [resonates w/] trap, hunt, bait, taste of flesh
C.linkedContent: Derrida prefers s’acharner to harceler: [resonates w/] trap, hunt, bait, taste of flesh

C.content: order of narrative, whose trap has been situated by logic of cartouche
C.linkedContent: order of narrative, whose trap has been situated by logic of cartouche

C.content: unity of a period (of a detour) is indeterminable: each article presents perforated cards that transform the other > tombe, in the snare (dans le lacs)
C.linkedContent: unity of a period (of a detour) is indeterminable: each article presents perforated cards that transform the other > tombe, in the snare (dans le lacs)

LI.content: Derrida’s uneasiness about using words “force” and “power” [eg. Foucault’s micropowers]—he has 3 conditions for using them: 1) no power/force, only differences of power/force (like Nietzsche) 2) realize the greater force could be the “lesser” 3) account for fact that force/power quickly trapped in ruses of mastery
LI.linkedContent: Derrida’s uneasiness about using words “force” and “power” [eg. Foucault’s micropowers]—he has 3 conditions for using them: 1) no power/force, only differences of power/force (like Nietzsche) 2) realize the greater force could be the “lesser” 3) account for fact that force/power quickly trapped in ruses of mastery

ATM.content: the trap of obeying Levinas in restituting nothing, one becomes deaf to his obligation, but it only feels like a trap when inclined toward mastery, when one pretends to escape from absolute dissymmetry
ATM.linkedContent: the trap of obeying Levinas in restituting nothing, one becomes deaf to his obligation, but it only feels like a trap when inclined toward mastery, when one pretends to escape from absolute dissymmetry

ATM.content: [re: Levinas] no edges in this interruptive series, in this incomparable stricture, but tapering points (establishing continuity at a distance [?]) > binding & unbinding, the lace (lacet) of obligation is in place (not a trap): an ob-ligation that un-binds, opens up religion in this very unbinding
ATM.linkedContent: [re: Levinas] no edges in this interruptive series, in this incomparable stricture, but tapering points (establishing continuity at a distance [?]) > binding & unbinding, the lace (lacet) of obligation is in place (not a trap): an ob-ligation that un-binds, opens up religion in this very unbinding

BSi.content: for Machiavelli, fox is closest to truth of man and man’s fidelity: knows who to lie, commit perjury, has sense/culture of snare [for Machiavelli, lion is too bête]
BSi.linkedContent: for Machiavelli, fox is closest to truth of man and man’s fidelity: knows who to lie, commit perjury, has sense/culture of snare [for Machiavelli, lion is too bête]

BSi.content: trap of sovereignty, trap of transfer of sovereignty > in all these fictions and simulacra blood flows, no less cruelly, irreversibly: beast & sovereign bleed, so do marionettes
BSi.linkedContent: trap of sovereignty, trap of transfer of sovereignty > in all these fictions and simulacra blood flows, no less cruelly, irreversibly: beast & sovereign bleed, so do marionettes

BSi.content: political revolution w/out poetic revolution of political > just a transfer of sovereignty
BSi.linkedContent: political revolution w/out poetic revolution of political > just a transfer of sovereignty

BSi.content: Bemächtigungstrieb: beyond other drives, beyond death drive, think sovereignty through drive, transference, inheritance, transmission, sovereignty itself is nothing, is excess, beyond everything
BSi.linkedContent: Bemächtigungstrieb: beyond other drives, beyond death drive, think sovereignty through drive, transference, inheritance, transmission, sovereignty itself is nothing, is excess, beyond everything

OG.content: writing as “trap,” pathology (blind), idolatry; for Saussure, Leibniz’s fixed language would be like a hen hatching a duck’s egg > “la perversion de l’artifice engendre des monstres”
OG.linkedContent: writing as “trap,” pathology (blind), idolatry; for Saussure, Leibniz’s fixed language would be like a hen hatching a duck’s egg > “la perversion de l’artifice engendre des monstres”

SPEC.content: [Freud’s speculation on Ernst] needs no witness, no counter-testimony has weight before this teleological auto-institution
SPEC.linkedContent: [Freud’s speculation on Ernst] needs no witness, no counter-testimony has weight before this teleological auto-institution

SPEC.content: net (filet) is in place, one pulls on a string (fil), getting a hand, foot, caught: c’est un lasso ou un lacet > Freud caught himself in advance; rapporté différé (deferred overlapping) > describing in advance scene of its own description
SPEC.linkedContent: net (filet) is in place, one pulls on a string (fil), getting a hand, foot, caught: c’est un lasso ou un lacet > Freud caught himself in advance; rapporté différé (deferred overlapping) > describing in advance scene of its own description

SPEC.content: that which entraps speculation: murderous, mournful, jealous, guilty identifications [re: Freud’s relation to death of his & Ernst’s younger brother] > rigorous stricture, legacy & jealousy of a repetition (already jealous of itself) pull its [fort:da’s] strings (tirent les fils) more or less strictly > scene of writing becomes auto-bio-thanato-hetero-graphic
SPEC.linkedContent: that which entraps speculation: murderous, mournful, jealous, guilty identifications [re: Freud’s relation to death of his & Ernst’s younger brother] > rigorous stricture, legacy & jealousy of a repetition (already jealous of itself) pull its [fort:da’s] strings (tirent les fils) more or less strictly > scene of writing becomes auto-bio-thanato-hetero-graphic

SPEC.content: quasi-proper name is the X that speculates [re: Freud’s Beyond…] w/out identity: sets in place proper trap of its suspension, limits itself in order to increase itself—if it did not limit itself: absolute discharge, disbanding, nothingness of death
SPEC.linkedContent: quasi-proper name is the X that speculates [re: Freud’s Beyond…] w/out identity: sets in place proper trap of its suspension, limits itself in order to increase itself—if it did not limit itself: absolute discharge, disbanding, nothingness of death

FV.content: for Lacan, signifier’s materiality (not empirical) due to certain indivisibility and locality (found where it isn’t) > indivisibility & locality are indissociable—rivet us (nous river), make us arrive at that which properly links singular to signature: guarantee of unity of signifier
FV.linkedContent: for Lacan, signifier’s materiality (not empirical) due to certain indivisibility and locality (found where it isn’t) > indivisibility & locality are indissociable—rivet us (nous river), make us arrive at that which properly links singular to signature: guarantee of unity of signifier
